docs.snippet: Dr. Alberto Guani, Uruguayan Foreign Minister and Vice President-elect, arrived early yesterday morning from Canada, where he spent three days as official guest of the government. He was greeted here by diplomatic officials, who included the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Alberto Guani, Uruguayan Foreign Minister and Vice President-elect, arrived early yesterday morning from Canada, where he spent three days as official guest of the government. He was greeted here by diplomatic officials, who included the Uruguayan Consul General, Santiago Rivas Costa, while a police escort stood at attention.

headline.main: GUANI HERE FROM CANADA; Uruguayan Sees Renewal of Relations With Soviet

docs.snippet: Dr. Alberto Guani, Minister of Foreign Affairs and Vice President-elect of Uruguay, now visiting this country, declared in a speech here last night that "no country can consider itself independent of the lot and fate of the other countries that form...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Alberto Guani, Minister of Foreign Affairs and Vice President-elect of Uruguay, now visiting this country, declared in a speech here last night that "no country can consider itself independent of the lot and fate of the other countries that form the international community."

headline.main: DR. GUANI STRESSES UNITY OF AMERICAS; The Vice President-Elect of Uruguay Is Guest of the Pan-American Society HE PRAISES ROOSEVELT Says Recent Trip Proves the President Has 'All Qualities of a Great Soldier'

docs.snippet: Dr. Alberto Guani, vice president-elect of Uruguay, declared last night at the Hotel Roosevelt that "we cannot now think of future boundaries; what now interests us is the abolition of political slavery in the post-war world."
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Alberto Guani, vice president-elect of Uruguay, declared last night at the Hotel Roosevelt that "we cannot now think of future boundaries; what now interests us is the abolition of political slavery in the post-war world."

headline.main: POLITICAL LIBERTY CALLED AIM IN WAR; Boundaries Are Secondary, Dr. Guani, Vice President-Elect of Uruguay, Declares

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 -- President Roosevelt received Dr. Alberto Guani, Foreign Minister and Vice President-elect of Uruguay; William Green, president of the A.F. of L., and Philip Murray, president of the C.I.O.; Lord Halifax and his son, Major...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 3 -- President Roosevelt received Dr. Alberto Guani, Foreign Minister and Vice President-elect of Uruguay; William Green, president of the A.F. of L., and Philip Murray, president of the C.I.O.; Lord Halifax and his son, Major Charles Wood, and the Pacific War Council.

docs.snippet: The decision of the railroads to accept the suggestion made by the Interstate Commerce Commission that they use the revenues resulting from the increases in rates granted last year for debt retirement and property improvements was not unexpected.
docs.lead_paragraph: The decision of the railroads to accept the suggestion made by the Interstate Commerce Commission that they use the revenues resulting from the increases in rates granted last year for debt retirement and property improvements was not unexpected.

headline.main: TOPICS OF INTEREST IN WALL STREET

docs.snippet: THIS book is perhaps the most important effort thus far on the part of North Americans in the rather testy business of appealing to and understanding the Latin-American temperament. There are many reasons for this -- negative as well as positive. One...
docs.lead_paragraph: THIS book is perhaps the most important effort thus far on the part of North Americans in the rather testy business of appealing to and understanding the Latin-American temperament. There are many reasons for this -- negative as well as positive. One of the most obvious positive ones is that it shows the Latins that we are concretely interested in their culture.
docs.abstract: Fitts, D (ed); Anthology of Contemporary Latin-American Poetry

headline.main: The Poets of Latin-America; AN ANTHOLOGY OF CONTEMPORARY LATIN-AMERICAN POETRY. Edited by Dudley Fitts. 667 pp. Norfolk, Conn.: New Directions Press. $3.50.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 6 (U.P.) -- Brazilian police accused a former police official and a lawyer today of having received "millions of cruzeiros to free German spies" and facilitate their escape to Uruguay and Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 6 (U.P.) -- Brazilian police accused a former police official and a lawyer today of having received "millions of cruzeiros to free German spies" and facilitate their escape to Uruguay and Argentina.
